repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

msContents.summary:
The manuscript contains two texts one is Garuḍapurāṇasāroddhāra and the second is Rukmāṅgadacaritra. The chapter ending colophon says iti Garuḍapurāṇasāroddhāre but the end colophon mentions title as Garuḍapurāṇa. The only published text available of Garuḍapurāṇasāroddhāra is by the Geeta press Gorkhapur in 2006. The manuscript of the Garuḍapurāṇa was completed between year 1883-1884 (CE) on Monday, tenth day of the month śrāvaṇa of the ‘sun's progress south of the equator’ i.e dakṣiṇāyana of the subhānu saṁvatsar. The manuscript is completed by the Subrahmaṇya, son of the Sāṁbhaśivaśārstri.
The second text Rukmāṅgadacaritra is from the Nāradiyapurāṇa. The same caritra is also part of Padmapurāṇa. The chapters of the Rukmāṅgadacaritra differ from the published one. The sequence of the verses is different and the chapter 33 from the edition on Gretil is chapter 38 of the manuscript and the oldest edition published by Khemraj ShriKrishnadas Venkateshwar Steam Press, Bombay, 1867.
Numbering is separate for the two texts. On the front guard folio is written satyaṁ jñānanamanantaṁ brahma, twice. There is also some verse but not readable as the shelmark stickers are glued and the akṣaras are also faint. Recto of the first blank folio has some circle shapes imprinted with the sharp instrument.

msItem.title: Garuḍapurāṇasāroddhāra
msItem.explicit: mayā yu ssādhu sādhuriti stuvan | śaṁ tejakṣayasatuṣṭā garuḍā|śrayaṇe na tu | śrutaṅte sarvamākhyānaṁ yamalokabhayāvahaṁ jantunāṁ mokṣanāmāyam mayā coktaṁ khageśvara |
msItem.finalRubric:
iti śrigaruḍapurāṇe sāro
ddhāre kṛṣṇatāya saṁvāde uttarakhaṇḍe pretaka dāna praśaṁsamahimo nāma dvātriṁśodhyāyaḥ | hariḥ oṁ |
msItem.colophon:
subhānu saṁvatsare dakṣiṇāyane śrāvaṇa
māse daśamyaṁ tithau hastanakṣatrayukta somavāsare sāṁbhaśivaśārstriṇā putreṇa subrahmaṇyena garuḍapurāṇaṁ likhitaṁ ettu 4 10 2

msItem.title: Rukmāṅgadacaritra
msItem.incipit: aśvamedhasaha[srā](ṇa)[ṇi] raja(ve)[sū]yaśatāni ca | ekādaśyupavāsasya kalāṁ nārhati ṣoḍaśīm ||
msItem.explicit:
uvāca vacanandevī dharmāanuśiṣṭā bahuvidhayanmayā bhūpa tvayā yathā nānyadrocayate subhujanmohinī mohasaṁyuktā bhojanaṁ vā hari
dine vadhaṁ vā tana

support.p: Guard folio broken. Initial layer of the folio is broken.

extent.measure: 2 guard folios, 42 and 53 written folios for the two texts, 7 blank folios (3 at the beginning and 4 at the end)

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numerals are used for numbering. Numbering is in the left margin. Numbers are damaged mostly due to wormholes. Separate numbering for the two texts.
supportDesc.condition: Worm-holes. Edges are broken. Akṣaras are damaged due to wormholes.

handNote.desc: Strokes are very round so many times confusing to read. Special joining akṣara n with the following letter is very mixed that it is difficult to read. The i sign is missing at some places and words are misspelled.

decoNote.desc: Recto of the first blank folio has some circle shapes imprinted with the sharp instrument.

additions.desc: 48 number in pink pencil at the front guard folio.
Total number of the leaves mentioned at the end of the colophon of the Garuḍapurāṇa. ettu 4 10 2.

listBibl.bibl:
Garuḍapurāṇasāroddhāra, Geetapress Gorakhapur 2006.
Bṛhad Nāradīyapurāṇa, by Khemraj ShriKrishnadas Venkateshwar Steam Press, Bombay, 1867. The edition available on the Gretil has no Bibliographical information given.

encodingDesc.p: ? marks are used to show the illegible letter. Square brackets are used to show corrections and round brackets are used to show the original writing in the manuscript.

TEI.text:
śrīrāmacandrāya namaḥ ekadā munayassarve naimiṣāraṇyavāsīnaḥ | āgatya su na sukhāsīnaṁ śucir[śa]?minaḥ | rudrākṣamālādharaṇaṁ trip? kitamastakaṁ pujā? [kāra?] vidhivat
yajñopavitakam | kecicca satrāṇī dattā | kecitca barāṇī ca | pūjayitvā tu vidhivat gandhapuṣpākṣatādibhiḥ havaṁ pujāñca nirvatya kṣamāpya ca punaḥ punaḥ pradakṣiṇantataḥ kṛtvā sarve tejakṣayastataḥ | kadā para
mayā yu ssādhu sādhuriti stuvan | śaṁ tejakṣayasatuṣṭā garuḍā|śrayaṇe na tu | śrutaṅte sarvamākhyānaṁ yamalokabhayāvahaṁ jantunāṁ mokṣanāmāyam mayā coktaṁ khageśvara | iti śrigaruḍapurāṇe sāro
ddhāre kṛṣṇatāya saṁvāde uttarakhaṇḍe pretaka dāna praśaṁsamahimo nāma dvātriṁśodhyāyaḥ | hariḥ oṁ | subhānu saṁvatsare dakṣiṇāyane śrāvaṇa
māse daśamyaṁ tithau hastanakṣatrayukta somavāsare sāṁbhaśivaśārstriṇā putreṇa subrahmaṇyena garuḍapurāṇaṁ likhitaṁ ettu 4 10 2 ??

aśvamedhasaha[srā](ṇa)[ṇi] raja(ve)[sū]yaśatāni ca | ekādaśyupavāsasya kalāṁ nārhati ṣoḍaśīm || ekādaśaindriyaiḥ pāpaṁ yatkṛtaṁ bhavati prabho ekādaśyupa
vāsena tatsarvam vilayaṁ vrajet ||
dadhikaṁ viduḥ | ityevaduktvā kanakāvadātā vimohinīṁ paṅkajajātāṁ saṁgṛhya bhartṛcaraṇā sujātā sajyāvali cā
vādya tasthe | iti nāradīyepurāṇe rukmāṁgadacaritre saptatriṁśodhyāyaḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ saṅdhyāvalī tataḥ pādau bhartussaṁgṛhya bhupate |
uvāca vacanandevī dharmāanuśiṣṭā bahuvidhayanmayā bhūpa tvayā yathā nānyadrocayate subhujanmohinī mohasaṁyuktā bhojanaṁ vā hari
dine vadhaṁ vā tana
